page.title: 11GLASGOW STUD
page.content: Glasgow Stud in Burnt Farm Ride, occupies 176 acres, comprising 20 acres of woodland, 6 acres of building land, 80 acres of arable and 70 acres of pasture.The Stud was established in 1824 for hunting at Theobalds Estate. Bloodstock was kept until 10 years ago, when they went to Newmarket.There have been some interesting owners and horses, including Milrieffe.Now, there are 60 horses, some bred at the Stud, kept for events and riding.Horses start work at 3 yeaars, and when too old are put out to grass.Stabling costs from Â£42 for livery to Â£12 for D.I.Y. 10 girls and 3 men work there.The stud grows some of its own hay, straw and corn.The land is crossed by a road, and a public foot- path.The woodland is home for badgers, rabbits, foxes and deer.
